docs.lead_paragraph: Liverpool rediscovered flashes of their most vibrant attacking form to repel an Arsenal fightback at a jubilant Anfield on Saturday and leapfrog Arsene Wenger's men in the battle for Champions League places.

headline.print_headline: Wijnaldum Seals Liverpool Win Over Arsenal
headline.main: Wijnaldum Seals Liverpool Win Over Arsenal

docs.lead_paragraph: Tommy Page, a former pop star whose song "I'll Be Your Everything" went to No. 1 in 1990 and who later became a record company executive, publisher of Billboard magazine, a vice president at Pandora and an executive at The Village Voice, has died. He was 46.

headline.print_headline: Veteran Music Executive and Former Pop Star Tommy Page Dies
headline.main: Veteran Music Executive and Former Pop Star Tommy Page Dies

docs.lead_paragraph: Two-time defending champion Pablo Cuevas of Uruguay can make it three straight in the Brazil Open after beating top-seeded Pablo Carreno Busta of Spain in the semifinals 6-3, 7-6 (2) on Saturday.

headline.print_headline: 2-Time Defending Champion Cuevas Goes for 3 in Brazil Open

docs.lead_paragraph: Supporters of Donald Trump clashed with counter-protesters at a rally in the famously left-leaning city of Berkeley, California, on a day of mostly peaceful gatherings in support of the U.S. president across the country.

headline.print_headline: In Day of Pro-Trump Rallies, California March Turns Violent
headline.main: In Day of Pro-Trump Rallies, California March Turns Violent

docs.lead_paragraph: In the closest election results ever in Northern Ireland, Sinn Fein, the main Catholic nationalist party, won only one seat fewer than the Democratic Unionist party, throwing nearly two decades of peaceful power sharing into turmoil.

headline.main: Sinn Fein Upends Elections in Northern Ireland

docs.lead_paragraph: Cheshire cat grins flashed across the faces of Villanova senior guards Josh Hart and Kris Jenkins as they pondered coming home to the D.C. area to face Georgetown one last time.
